Context:
* Students are required to carry their student ID card when on campus for accessing services, academic activities, attendance in classes, writing tests and exams.
* Student ID cards are used as borrower cards at the Library Learning Commons (LLC) for borrowing books, A/V equipment, laptops and other electronic devices, and as a print/copy card.
* Students need to tap their valid student cards to access Athletic Centres at St James Campus and Casa Loma Campus and submit their cards to use sports equipment.
* Student ID cards may be required for taking tests and exams.
* George Brown College contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
* Students can sign up for college news, application deadlines, upcoming events, tours and more on the website.
* Information on the website is subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty.
* Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
